junit.framework.Test
public class AddCardTest extends junit.framework.TestCase
This class is used to test the addition of cards to a placement area.

  • Method Details

    • initializeStarterCard

      public static void initializeStarterCard(PlacementArea area, Deck[] deckList, int starterCard, boolean faceStarterCard)
      This method is used to initialize a starter card in the placement area.
      Parameters:
      area - The placement area where the card will be placed.
      deckList - The list of decks from which the card will be retrieved.
      starterCard - The ID of the starter card.
      faceStarterCard - The face side of the starter card.

    • initialize

      public static int initialize(PlacementArea area, ArrayList<Integer> cardList, ArrayList<Coordinates> coord, boolean face, Deck[] deckList)
      This method is used to initialize the placement area with a list of cards.
      Parameters:
      area - The placement area where the cards will be placed.
      cardList - The list of card IDs to be placed.
      coord - The list of coordinates where the cards will be placed.
      face - The face side of the cards.
      deckList - The list of decks from which the cards will be retrieved.
      Returns:
      The total points of the placed cards.

    • putCards

      public static int putCards(ArrayList<Integer> cards, ArrayList<Coordinates> coordList, boolean face, PlacementArea area, Deck[] deckList) throws RuntimeException
      Places the cards in the placement area.
      Parameters:
      cards - The list of card IDs to be placed.
      coordList - The list of coordinates where the cards will be placed.
      face - The face side of the cards.
      area - The placement area where the cards will be placed.
      deckList - The list of decks from which the cards will be retrieved.
      Returns:
      The total points of the placed cards.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the number of cards does not match the number of coordinates or if a card cannot be placed in the area.

    • testSingoli

      public void testSingoli()
      This method is used to test the placement of cards in the area. It creates instances of various deck generators and generates the decks. It then defines the parameters for two test cases (a and b) and runs these tests. Each test case includes the cards to be placed, their coordinates, expected results, face side of the cards, starter card details, expected number of each element and artifact, expected available positions, expected disposition of cards, expected number of nearby cards, and details of any expected exceptions. The tests are run using the `runTest` method.

    • runTest

      public void runTest(int[] cards, int[] coordinates, int expectedResults, boolean face, int starterCard, boolean faceStarterCard, int expAnimals, int expInsects, int expMushrooms, int expVegetals, int expFeather, int expInk, int expPaper, List<Coordinates> expAvailablePosition, HashMap<Coordinates,PlayableCard> expDisposition, int expNumberNearbyCards, int[] exceptionCoord, int exceptionCard, int exceptionCode)
      Runs a test for the placement of cards in the area.
      Parameters:
      cards - An array of card IDs to be placed.
      coordinates - An array of coordinates where the cards will be placed.
      expectedResults - The expected result of the test.
      face - The face side of the cards.
      starterCard - The ID of the starter card.
      faceStarterCard - The face side of the starter card.
      expAnimals - The expected number of animal elements.
      expInsects - The expected number of insect elements.
      expMushrooms - The expected number of mushroom elements.
      expVegetals - The expected number of vegetal elements.
      expFeather - The expected number of feather artifacts.
      expInk - The expected number of ink artifacts.
      expPaper - The expected number of paper artifacts.
      expAvailablePosition - The expected list of available positions after the cards are placed.
      expDisposition - The expected disposition of the cards in the area.
      expNumberNearbyCards - The expected number of nearby cards.
      exceptionCoord - The coordinates where an exception is expected to occur.
      exceptionCard - The card ID where an exception is expected to occur.
      exceptionCode - The expected exception code.
